In other words, it’s less about a single hard rule (like “no messages for X rounds”) and more about the practical need to avoid the place remaining unfilled as the process nears its end.

conversation.message:
Hello Nursery_B, Parent_E here.

I understand you’re holding the place according to your priority order, and I respect that. Since you are the only nursery still unmatched at round 10, I wanted to make it as easy as possible for you to fill the place if/when you decide to move to an offer from the remaining pool.

If you were to offer us the spot at any point, I can (1) confirm acceptance the same day within a few hours, (2) complete all paperwork and any deposit immediately, and (3) be fully flexible on start date/schedule and transition planning.

To help your planning, would you be willing to note us as a ready “fallback” family so that if no higher-priority family applies by the point you need to finalize intake (even if that’s later), you can issue an offer quickly without further back-and-forth? If there’s any enrollment step you would need from us in advance (forms, documents, preferred start window), please tell me and I’ll provide it right away.

Thank you again for keeping us in mind.

Yes—we can note that you are prepared to move quickly if we reach a point where we need to make an offer from the remaining pool. Hello Parent_E, thank you for the update and for staying so ready to move quickly.

On your question about our planning horizon: we don’t have a single fixed “latest round,” but in rough terms we would expect to need to lock the place quite late in the process—approximately in the final third of the remaining rounds (i.e., around rounds ~20–25) if we still have not received an application from any higher-priority family and we need to finalize staffing/intake.

I want to be clear that this is only a rough internal planning window, not a commitment to offer at a specific round, because we still must follow our priority order if a higher-priority family applies before we finalize.

If you’d like to help us move instantly *if* we do switch to an offer from the remaining pool, the most useful additional details would be:
1) Child’s date of birth (or age), and
2) Any key needs we should plan for (allergies/medical notes, language support, etc.).

Thank you again—if our status changes and we are able to proceed with an offer, we will contact you promptly.
